</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-LEFT:48PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	Our search conducted, through Cede &amp; Co. in the United States, revealed there are 55 holders of record resident in the United States owning 11,255,511 shares of Common Stock (CDS held a deficit of 6,425,068 shares of Common Stock).
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	We are required to file annual reports on Form 20-F and periodic reports on Form 6-K. &nbsp;As a foreign private issuer, we are not subject to the reporting obligations of Exchange Act Section 14's proxy rules or Section 16's insider short-swing profit rules.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX">
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:13.333PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:3.333PX">
<B>
<I>
	Related Party Transactions
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX">
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	Certain of ours directors and officers serve as directors or officers of other reporting companies or have significant shareholdings in other reporting companies and, to the extent that such other companies may participate in ventures in which we may participate, our directors may have a conflict of interest in negotiating and concluding terms respecting the extent of such participation. &nbsp;In the event that such a conflict of interest arises at a meeting of our directors, a director who has such a conflict will abstain from voting for or against the approval of such participation or such terms. &nbsp;From time to time several companies may participate in the acquisition, exploration and development of natural resource properties thereby allowing for their participation in larger programs, permitting involvement in a greater number of programs and reducing financial exposure in respect of any one program. &nbsp;It may also occur that a particular company will assign all or a portion of its interest in a particular program to another of these companies due to the financial position of the company making the assignment. &nbsp;Under the laws of British Columbia, our directors are required to act honestly, in good faith and in the best interests of our company. &nbsp;In determining whether or not our company will participate in a particular program and the interest therein to be acquired by it, the directors will primarily consider the degree of risk to which we may be exposed and our financial position at the time.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	Management believes that the transactions referenced below were on terms at least as favorable to us as we could have obtained from unaffiliated parties.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX">
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	Other than disclosed elsewhere in this Annual Report, none of the directors, senior officers, principal stockholders named in &#147;Item 7 &#150; Major Shareholders and Related Party Transactions&#148;, or any relative or spouse of the foregoing, have had an interest, direct or indirect, in any transaction, during the current financial year ending August 31, 2006, or in any proposed transaction which has materially affected or will materially affect our company or any of our subsidiaries except for the following:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX">
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:-16PX; PADDING-LEFT:48PX; TEXT-INDENT:-48PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	1.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-LEFT:48PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	R. Michael Jones, our Chairman, President, Chief Executive Officer and director managed the day-to-day operations of our company. &nbsp;During Fiscal 2006, Mr. Jones was paid and/or accrued $145,980 and a bonus of $50,000 for consulting services rendered pursuant to the terms of a consulting agreement. &nbsp;See &#147;Item 6 &#150; Directors, Senior Management and Employees&#148;.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:-16PX; PADDING-LEFT:48PX; TEXT-INDENT:-48PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	2.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-LEFT:48PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	Frank R. Hallam is employed as our Chief Financial Officer. &nbsp;During Fiscal 2006, Mr. Hallam received salary payments totaling $123,750 and a bonus of $30,000 pursuant to the terms of an employment agreement. &nbsp;See &#147;Item 6 &#150; Directors, Senior Management and Employees&#148;.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:-16PX; PADDING-LEFT:48PX; TEXT-INDENT:-48PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	3.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-LEFT:48PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	Barry Smee, our Secretary and director provided geological consulting services. &nbsp;During Fiscal 2006, Mr. Smee was paid and/or accrued $4,980 for consulting services rendered. &nbsp;Mr. Smee did not have an agreement but was paid upon the rendering of services and receipt of expense reports and/or invoices. &nbsp;See &#147;Item 6 &#150; Directors, Senior Management and Employees&#148;.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>

	4.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-LEFT:48PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	John Gould, the Managing Director of PTM-RSA provided management and consulting services. &nbsp;During Fiscal 2006, Mr. Gould was paid and/or accrued $132,350 for management and consulting services rendered. &nbsp;Mr. Gould was paid pursuant to terms agreed to in 2003. &nbsp;See &#147;Item 6 &#150; Directors, Senior Management and Employees&#148;.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>

</P>

</P>

<BR>

<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:18.667PX; MARGIN:0PX; FONT-SIZE:16PX">
<B>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:13.333PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:3.333PX">
<B>
<I>
	Consolidated Financial Statements and Other Financial Information
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	See the audited consolidated financial statements listed in Item 17 hereof and filed as part of this Annual Report. &nbsp;These financial statements include our consolidated balance sheets as at August 31, 2006 and 2005 and our statements of operations and cash flows for the three years ended August 31, 2006.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	These financial statements were prepared in accordance with accounting principles generally accepted in Canada. &nbsp;Differences between accounting principles generally accepted in Canada and in the United States, as applicable to our company, are set forth in Note 15 to the accompanying consolidated financial statements.
</P>

	There are no pending or material proceedings to which our company is or is likely to be a party or of which any of our properties is or is likely to be the subject.

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:13.333PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:3.333PX">
<B>
<I>
	Dividend Policy
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	We have not declared any dividends and we not anticipate doing so in the foreseeable future. &nbsp;Our present policy is to retain future earnings for use in our operations and the expansion of our business.
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:13.333PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:3.333PX">
<B>
<I>
	Significant Changes
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	Since August 31, 2006, the following significant changes have occurred:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:-16PX; PADDING-LEFT:48PX; TEXT-INDENT:-48PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	1.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-LEFT:48PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	2,515,069 shares of Common Stock were issued pursuant to the exercise of 2,433,194 warrants at a price of $1.50 per share, 50,000 stock options at a price of $1.10 per share and 31,875 stock options at a price of $1.00 per share for aggregate proceeds of $3,736,665.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>

	Item 10 &#150; Additional Information
</B>
</P>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC507527384">

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:13.333PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:3.333PX">
<B>
<I>
	Share Capital
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX">
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL; MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	Our authorized capital consists of an unlimited number of shares of Common Stock without par value, of which 56,206,247 shares of Common Stock were issued and outstanding as at November 17, 2006. &nbsp;All of the issued shares of Common Stock are fully paid. &nbsp;Our company does not own any shares of Common Stock.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	The stockholders are entitled to one vote for each share on all matters to be voted on by the stockholders. &nbsp;Each share of Common Stock is equal to every other share of Common Stock and all shares participate equally on liquidation, dissolution or winding up of our company, whether voluntary or involuntary, or any other distribution of our assets among our stockholders for the purpose of winding up our affairs after we have paid out our liabilities. &nbsp;The stockholders are entitled to vote for each share held and are entitled to receive
<I>
	pro rata
</I>
	such dividends as may be declared by the board of directors out of funds legally available therefore and to receive
<I>
	pro rata
</I>
	the remaining property of our company upon dissolution. &nbsp;No shares have been issued subject to call or assessment. &nbsp;There are no pre-emptive or conversion rights, and no provisions for redemption, purchase or cancellation, surrender, sinking fund or purchase fund. &nbsp;Provisions as to the creation, modification, amendment or variation of such rights or such provisions are contained in the
<I>
	Business Corporations Act
</I>
	(British Columbia)
<I>
</I>
	(the &#147;BCA&#148;)
<I>
	.
</I>
</P>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC507527385">
</A>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC507527606">
</A>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC507531679">
</A>

</A>

</A>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:13.333PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:3.333PX">
<B>
<I>
	Memorandum and Articles of Association
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX">
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX">
<B>
<I>
	Objects and Purposes
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	Our Articles do not prescribe any extraordinary limits on the businesses or purposes of our company.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX">
<BR>
</P>
<HR STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:9.6PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:9.6PX" NOSHADE SIZE=1.333>
<A NAME="eolPage59"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS">
	59
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX">
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX">
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<B>
<I>
	Directors
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	Part 17 of our Articles deals with the directors&#146; involvement in transactions in which they have an interest. Article 17.2 provides that a director who holds a disclosable interest in a contract or transaction into which we have entered or propose to enter is not entitled to vote on any directors' resolution to approve that contract or transaction, unless all the directors have a disclosable interest in that contract or transaction, in which case any or all of those directors may vote on such resolution.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	Pursuant to the BCA, a director does not have a disclosable interest in a contract or transaction merely because the contract or transaction relates to the remuneration of the director in that person's capacity as a director of our company.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	Part 8 of our Articles deals with borrowing powers. Our company, if authorized by the directors, may: (i) borrow money in the manner and amount, on the security, from the sources and on the terms and conditions that they consider appropriate; (ii) issue bonds, debentures and other debt obligations either outright or as security for any liability or obligation of our company or any other person and at such discounts or premiums and on such other terms as they consider appropriate; (iii) guarantee the repayment of money by any other person or the performance of any obligation of any other person; and (iv) mortgage, charge, whether by way of specific or floating charge, grant a security interest in, or give other security on, the whole or any part of the present and future assets and undertaking of our company.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<B>
<I>
	Qualifications of Directors
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX">
	Our Articles do not specify a retirement age for directors.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX">
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX">
	Directors are not required to own any Common Stock.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	Section 124 of the BCA
<I>
</I>
	provides that no person is qualified to act as a director if that person is:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:-16PX; PADDING-LEFT:48PX; TEXT-INDENT:-48PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	(a)
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-LEFT:48PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	under the age of 18 years;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:-16PX; PADDING-LEFT:48PX; TEXT-INDENT:-48PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	(b)
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-LEFT:48PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	found by a court, in Canada or elsewhere, to be incapable of managing the individual's own affairs;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:-16PX; PADDING-LEFT:48PX; TEXT-INDENT:-48PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	(c)
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-LEFT:48PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	an undischarged bankrupt, or
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:-16PX; PADDING-LEFT:48PX; TEXT-INDENT:-48PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	(d)
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-LEFT:48PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	convicted in or out of British Columbia of an offence in connection with the promotion, formation or management of a corporation or unincorporated business, or of an offence involving fraud, unless
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:-16PX; PADDING-LEFT:96PX; TEXT-INDENT:-48PX">
	(i)
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-LEFT:96PX">
	the court orders otherwise,
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX">
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:-16PX; PADDING-LEFT:96PX; TEXT-INDENT:-48PX">
	(ii)
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-LEFT:96PX">
	5 years have elapsed since the last to occur of
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX">
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:-16PX; PADDING-LEFT:144PX; TEXT-INDENT:-48PX">
	(A)
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-LEFT:144PX">
	the expiration of the period set for suspension of the passing of sentence without a sentence having been passed,
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX">
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:-16PX; PADDING-LEFT:144PX; TEXT-INDENT:-48PX">
	(B)
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-LEFT:144PX">
	the imposition of a fine,
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX">
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:-16PX; PADDING-LEFT:144PX; TEXT-INDENT:-48PX">
	(C)
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-LEFT:144PX">
	the conclusion of the term of any imprisonment, and
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX">
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:-16PX; PADDING-LEFT:144PX; TEXT-INDENT:-48PX">
	(D)
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-LEFT:144PX">
	the conclusion of the term of any probation imposed, or
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX">
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:-16PX; PADDING-LEFT:96PX; TEXT-INDENT:-48PX">
	(iii)
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-LEFT:96PX">
	a pardon was granted or issued under the Criminal Records Act (Canada).
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX">
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX">
	A director who ceases to be qualified to act as a director of a company must promptly resign.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	Section 120 of the BCA provides that every company must have at least one director, and a reporting company must have at least three directors.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX">
<BR>
</P>
<HR STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:9.6PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:9.6PX" NOSHADE SIZE=1.333>
<A NAME="eolPage60"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS">
	60
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX">
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX">
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<B>
<I>
	Rights, Preference and Restrictions
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	All of the authorized shares of Common Stock are of the same class and, once issued, rank equally as to dividends, voting powers, and participation in assets and in all other respects, on liquidation, dissolution or winding up of our company, whether voluntary or involuntary, or any other distribution of our assets among our stockholders for the purpose of winding up our affairs after we have paid out our liabilities. &nbsp;The issued shares of Common Stock are not subject to call or assessment rights or any pre-emptive or conversion rights. &nbsp;The stockholders are entitled to one vote for each share on all matters to be voted on by the stockholders. &nbsp;There are no provisions for redemption, purchase for cancellation, surrender or purchase funds.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	The rights of stockholders may be altered only with the approval of the holders of 2/3 or more of the Common Stock voted at a meeting of our stockholders called and held in accordance with applicable law.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<B>
<I>
	Annual General Meetings and Extraordinary General Meetings
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	Annual General Meetings are called and scheduled upon decision by the board of directors. Pursuant to the BCA, we are required to hold an annual meeting in each year, not more than 15 months after the date of the most recent annual meeting.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	The directors may convene an extraordinary general meeting of our stockholders. All meetings of the stockholders may be attended by registered stockholders or persons who hold powers of attorney or proxies given to them by registered stockholders.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<B>
<I>
	Limitations on Ownership of Securities
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	There are no limitations on the right to own securities, imposed by foreign law or by the charter or other constituent document of our company.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<B>
<I>
	Change in Control
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	There are no provisions in our Articles or charter documents that would have the effect of delaying, deferring or preventing a change in the control of our company, or that would operate with respect to any proposed merger, acquisition or corporate restructuring involving our company or any of our subsidiaries.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX">
<B>
<I>
	Ownership Threshold
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	There are no provisions in our Articles requiring share ownership to be disclosed. Securities legislation in Canada requires that stockholder ownership must be disclosed once a person owns beneficially or has control or direction over greater than 10% of the issued Common Stock. This threshold is higher than the 5% threshold under U.S. securities legislation at which stockholders must report their share ownership.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<B>
<I>
	Changes to Capital
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	There are no conditions imposed by our Articles governing changes in the capital where such conditions are more stringent than is required by the law of British Columbia.
</P>

</A>

<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC152560811">
</A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:13.333PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:3.333PX">
<B>
<I>
	Material Contracts
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	The following material contracts have been entered into by our company within the past two years, copies of which may be inspected between the hours of 10:00 am and 5:00 p.m. at our head office located at Suite 328 &#150; 550 Burrard Street, Vancouver, British Columbia, Canada, V6C 2B5.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:-16PX; PADDING-LEFT:48PX; TEXT-INDENT:-48PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	(a)
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-LEFT:48PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	We entered into a consulting agreement dated April 1, 2005 with R. Michael Jones, our President, Chief Executive Officer and a director pursuant to which Mr. Jones is paid a fee of $545 per day to manage our day-to-day operations for an indefinite term. &nbsp;This arrangement was amended effective August 1, 2006 as further described below. &nbsp;See &#147;Item 7 &#150; Major Shareholders and Related Party Transactions&#148;.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX">
<BR>
</P>
<HR STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:9.6PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:9.6PX" NOSHADE SIZE=1.333>

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS">
	61
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX">
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX">
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:-16PX; PADDING-LEFT:47.267PX; TEXT-INDENT:-47.267PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	(b)
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-LEFT:47.267PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	We entered into an employment agreement dated April 1, 2005 with Frank Hallam, our Chief Financial Officer and a director pursuant to which Mr. Hallam is paid a salary of $10,150 per month to manage our day-to-day financial operations for an indefinite term. &nbsp;This arrangement was amended effective August 1, 2006 as further described below. &nbsp;See &#147;Item 7 &#150; Major Shareholders and Related Party Transactions&#148;.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:-16PX; PADDING-LEFT:48PX; TEXT-INDENT:-48PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	(c)
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-LEFT:48PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	We entered into a consulting agreement dated August 1, 2006 with R. Michael Jones, our President, Chief Executive Officer and director pursuant to which Mr. Jones is paid a fee of $645 per day to manage our day-to-day operations for an indefinite term. &nbsp;See &#147;Item 7 &#150; Major Shareholders and Related Party Transactions&#148;.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:-16PX; PADDING-LEFT:47.267PX; TEXT-INDENT:-47.267PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	(d)
</P>

	We entered into an employment agreement dated August 1, 2006 with Frank Hallam, our Chief Financial Officer and director pursuant to which Mr. Hallam is paid a salary of $12,100 per month to manage our day-to-day financial operations for an indefinite term. &nbsp;See &#147;Item 7 &#150; Major Shareholders and Related Party Transactions&#148;.
</P>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC507527387">
</A>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC507527608">
</A>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC507531681">
</A>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC517420578">
</A>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC9353129">
</A>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC9353357">
</A>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC9353575">
</A>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC34011188">
</A>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC34011966">
</A>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC34012443">
</A>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC34794513">
</A>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC65804545">
</A>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC66840984">
</A>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC66841141">
</A>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC66841300">
</A>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC95278053">
</A>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC95278204">
</A>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC97613512">
</A>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC98285545">
</A>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC98298099">
</A>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC127645487">
</A>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC152340722">
</A>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC152340808">
</A>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC152560812">
</A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:13.333PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:3.333PX">
<B>
<I>
	Exchange Controls
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX">
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	There are no governmental laws, decrees or regulations in Canada relating to restrictions on the export or import of capital, or affecting the remittance of interest, dividends or other payments to non-resident stockholders. &nbsp;Any remittances of dividends to United States residents are, however, subject to a 15% withholding tax (5% if the stockholder is a corporation owning at least 10% of the outstanding shares of Common Stock) pursuant to Article X of the reciprocal tax treaty between Canada and the United States. &nbsp;See &#147;Taxation&#148;.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	Except as provided in the
<I>
	Investment Canada Act
</I>
	(the &#147;Act&#148;), which has provisions which govern the acquisition of a control block of voting shares by non-Canadians of a corporation carrying on a Canadian business, there are no limitations specific to the rights of non-Canadians to hold or vote the shares of Common Stock under the laws of Canada or the Province of British Columbia or in our charter documents.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	The following describes those provisions of the Act pertinent to an investment in our company by a person who is not a Canadian resident (a &#147;non-Canadian&#148;).
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	The Act requires a non-Canadian making an investment which would result in the acquisition of control of the Canadian business to notify the Investment Review Division of Industry Canada, the federal agency created by the Act; or in the case of an acquisition of a Canadian business, the gross value of the assets of which exceeds certain threshold levels of the business activity of which is related to Canada&#146;s cultural heritage or national identity, to file an application for review with the Investment Review Division.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	The notification procedure involves a brief statement of information about the investment on a prescribed form, which is required to be filed with Investment Canada by the investor at any time up to 30 days following implementation of the investment. It is intended that investments requiring only notification will proceed without government intervention unless the investment is in a specific type of business activity related to Canada&#146;s cultural heritage and national identity.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX">
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	If an investment is reviewable under the Act, an application for review in the form prescribed is required to be filed with Investment Canada prior to the investment taking place and the investment may not be implemented until the review has been completed and the Minister responsible for the Investment Canada Act is satisfied that the investment is likely to be of net benefit to Canada. If the Minister is not satisfied that the investment is likely to be of net benefit to Canada, the non-Canadian must not implement the investment or, if the investment has been implemented, may be required to divest himself of control of the business that is the subject of the investment.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX">
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	The following investments by non-Canadians are subject to notification under the Act:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:-16PX; PADDING-LEFT:48PX; TEXT-INDENT:-48PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	1.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-LEFT:48PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	an investment to establish a new Canadian business; and
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:-16PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	2.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:48PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	an investment to acquire control of a Canadian business that is not reviewable pursuant to the Act.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX">
<BR>
</P>
<HR STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:9.6PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:9.6PX" NOSHADE SIZE=1.333>
<A NAME="eolPage62"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS">
	62
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX">
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX">
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	The following investments by a non-Canadian are subject to review under the Act:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:-16PX; PADDING-LEFT:48PX; TEXT-INDENT:-48PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	1.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-LEFT:48PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	direct acquisitions of control of Canadian businesses with assets of $5 million or more, unless the acquisition is being made by a World Trade Organization (&#147;WTO&#148;) member country investor (the United States being a member of the WTO);
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:-16PX; PADDING-LEFT:48PX; TEXT-INDENT:-48PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	2.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-LEFT:48PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	direct acquisitions of control of Canadian businesses with assets of $172,000,000 or more by a WTO investor;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX">
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:-16PX; PADDING-LEFT:48PX; TEXT-INDENT:-48PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	3.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-LEFT:48PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	indirect acquisitions of control of Canadian businesses with assets of $5 million or more is such assets represent more than 50% of the total value of the assets of the entities, the control of which is being acquired, unless the &nbsp;acquisition is being made by a WTO investor, in which case there is no review;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:-16PX; PADDING-LEFT:48PX; TEXT-INDENT:-48PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	4.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-LEFT:48PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	indirect acquisitions of control of Canadian businesses with assets of $50 million or more even if such assets represent less than 50% or the total value of the assets of the entities, the control of which being acquired, unless the acquisition is being made by a WTO investor, in which case there is no review; and
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:-16PX; PADDING-LEFT:48PX; TEXT-INDENT:-48PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	5.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-LEFT:48PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	an investment subject to notification that would not otherwise be reviewable if the Canadian business engages in the activity of publication, distribution or sale for books, magazines, periodicals, newspapers, film or video recordings, audio or video music recordings, or music in print or machine-readable form.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	An acquisition is direct if it involves the acquisition of control of the Canadian business or of its Canadian parent or grandparent and an acquisition is indirect if it involves the acquisition of control of a non-Canadian parent or grandparent of an entity carrying on the Canadian business. Control may be acquired through the acquisition of actual voting control by the acquisition of voting shares of a Canadian corporation or through the acquisition of substantially all of the assets of the Canadian business. &nbsp;No change of voting control will be deemed to have occurred if less than one-third of the voting control of a Canadian corporation is acquired by an investor.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	A WTO investor, as defined in the Act, includes an individual who is a national of a member country of the World Trade Organization or who has the right of permanent residence in relation to that WTO member, a government or government agency of a WTO investor-controlled corporation, limited partnership, trust or joint venture and a corporation, limited partnership, trust or joint venture that is neither WTO-investor controlled or Canadian controlled of which two-thirds of its board of directors, general partners or trustees, as the case may be, are any combination of Canadians and WTO investors.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	The higher thresholds for WTO investors do not apply if the Canadian business engages in activities in certain sectors such as uranium, financial services, transportation services or communications.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	The Act specifically exempts certain transactions from either notification or review. &nbsp;Included among this category of transactions is the acquisition of voting shares or other voting interests by any person in the ordinary course of that person&#146;s business as a trader or dealer in securities.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	The Regulations under the Act specifies the remedies, offences and punishment applicable. &nbsp;Section 39 states that &#147;When the Minister believes that a non-Canadian, contrary to this act (a) has failed to give notice; or (b) has implemented an investment which is prohibited&#148;, then the Minister may send a demand requiring the default to be remedied and if this demand is not complied with, the Minister may apply for a Court Order require divestiture or other remedies, as the circumstances require. &nbsp;Civil penalties apply for non-compliance with any provision, and criminal penalties may also apply.
</P>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC507527388">
</A>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC507527609">
</A>

</A>

</A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:13.333PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:3.333PX">
<B>
<I>
	Taxation
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX">
<BR>
</P>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC424542333">
</A>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC431180070">
</A>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC451566015">
</A>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC451593718">
</A>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC451598261">
</A>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC465535853">
</A>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC465797206">
</A>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC470249971">
</A>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC470537550">
</A>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC470540530">
</A>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC472946371">
</A>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC481240910">
</A>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC481245938">
</A>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC481419822">
</A>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC517420580">
</A>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC9353131">
</A>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC9353359">
</A>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC9353577">
</A>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC34011190">
</A>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC34011968">
</A>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC34012445">
</A>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC34794515">
</A>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC65804547">
</A>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC66840986">
</A>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC66841143">
</A>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC66841302">
</A>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC95278055">
</A>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC95278206">
</A>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC98298101">
</A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX">
<B>
	Canadian Federal Income Tax Consequences
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX">
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	The following is a discussion of the material Canadian federal income tax consequences applicable to a holder of shares of Common Stock who is a resident of the United States and who is not a resident of Canada and who does not use or hold, and is not deemed to use or hold, his shares of Common Stock in connection with carrying on a business in Canada and has not acquired the common shares in one or more transactions considered to be an adventure in the nature of trade (a &#147;non-resident
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX">
<BR>
</P>
<HR STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:9.6PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:9.6PX" NOSHADE SIZE=1.333>
<A NAME="eolPage63"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS">
	63
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX">
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX">
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	holder&#148;). &nbsp;Accordingly, stockholders and prospective investors should consult their own tax advisors for advice regarding their individual tax consequences.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	This summary is based upon the current provisions of the Income Tax Act (Canada) (the &#147;ITA&#148;), the regulations thereunder (the &#147;Regulations&#148;), the current publicly announced administrative and assessing policies of the Canada Revenue Agency, and all specific proposals (the &#147;Tax Proposals&#148;) to amend the ITA and Regulations announced by the Minister of Finance (Canada) prior to the date hereof. &nbsp;This summary assumes that the Tax Proposals will be enacted in their form as of the date of this Annual Report.
</P>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC424542334">
</A>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC431180071">
</A>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC451566016">
</A>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC451593719">
</A>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC451598262">
</A>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC465535854">
</A>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC465797207">
</A>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC470249972">
</A>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC470537551">
</A>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC470540531">
</A>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC472946372">
</A>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC481240911">
</A>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC481245939">
</A>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC481419823">
</A>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC517420581">
</A>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC9353132">
</A>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC9353360">
</A>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC9353578">
</A>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC34011191">
</A>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC34011969">
</A>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC34012446">
</A>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC34794516">
</A>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC65804548">
</A>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC66840987">
</A>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC66841144">
</A>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC66841303">
</A>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC95278056">
</A>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC95278207">
</A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX">
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX">
<I>
	Dividends
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX">
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	Under the ITA, dividends paid or deemed to have been paid by a corporation resident in Canada to a non-resident holder will generally be subject to withholding tax at a rate of 25%. &nbsp;The Canada-U.S. Income Tax Convention (1980) (the &#147;Treaty&#148;) provides that the normal 25% withholding tax rate under the ITA is reduced to 15% on dividends paid on shares of a corporation resident in Canada (such as our company) to beneficial owners of the dividends who are residents of the United States, and also provides for a further reduction of this rate to 5% where the beneficial owner of the dividends is also a company that is a resident of the United States which owns at least 10% of the voting shares of the corporation paying the dividend. &nbsp;However, if the U.S. resident stockholder is an LLC, the withholding rate is 25%.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX">
<BR>
</P>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC424542335">
</A>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC431180072">
</A>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC451566017">
</A>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC451593720">
</A>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC451598263">
</A>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC465535855">
</A>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC465797208">
</A>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC470249973">
</A>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC470537552">
</A>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC470540532">
</A>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC472946373">
</A>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC481240912">
</A>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC481245940">
</A>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC481419824">
</A>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC517420582">
</A>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC9353133">
</A>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC9353361">
</A>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC9353579">
</A>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC34011192">
</A>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC34011970">
</A>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC34012447">
</A>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC34794517">
</A>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC65804549">
</A>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC66840988">
</A>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC66841145">
</A>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC66841304">
</A>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC95278057">
</A>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC95278208">
</A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<I>
	Capital Gains
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX">
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	Under the ITA, a taxpayer&#146;s capital gain or capital loss from a disposition of a Common Share is the amount, if any, by which his proceeds of disposition exceed (or are exceeded by) the aggregate of his adjusted cost base of the share and reasonable expenses of disposition. &nbsp;Currently, regulations specify that one-half of a capital gain (the &#147;taxable capital gain&#148;) is included in income, and one-half of a capital loss in a year (the &#147;allowable capital loss&#148;) is deductible from taxable capital gains realized in the same year. &nbsp;The amount by which a stockholder&#146;s allowable capital loss exceeds his taxable capital gains in a year may be deducted from a taxable capital gain realized by the stockholder in the three previous or any subsequent year, subject to certain restrictions.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	A non-resident of Canada is not subject to tax under the ITA in respect of a capital gain realized upon the disposition of a share of a public corporation unless the share represents &#147;taxable Canadian property&#148; to the holder thereof. &nbsp;We are a public corporation for purposes of the ITA and our Common Stock is on a prescribed stock exchange. A share of Common Stock will be taxable Canadian property to a non-resident holder if, at any time during the period of five years immediately preceding the disposition, the non-resident holder, persons with whom the non-resident holder did not deal at arm&#146;s length, or the non-resident holder and persons with whom he did not deal at arm&#146;s length together owned not less than 25% of the issued shares of any class of shares of our company.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX">
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	Where a non-resident holder who is an individual ceased to be resident in Canada, and at the time he ceased to be a Canadian resident elected to have his shares of Common Stock treated as taxable Canadian property, he will be subject to Canadian tax on any capital gain realized on disposition of the shares of Common Stock, subject to the relieving provisions of the Treaty described below. &nbsp;The shares of Common Stock may also be taxable Canadian property to a holder if the holder acquired them pursuant to certain &#147;rollover&#148; transactions. &nbsp;This would include transactions under Sections 86 and 87 of the ITA, which apply to share for share and amalgamation transactions.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX">
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	Where a U.S. resident holder realizes a capital gain on a disposition of shares of Common Stock that constitute taxable Canadian property, the Treaty relieves the non-resident stockholder from liability for Canadian tax on such capital gains unless:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX">
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:-16PX; PADDING-LEFT:48PX; TEXT-INDENT:-48PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	(a)
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-LEFT:48PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	the value of the shares is derived principally from &#147;real property&#148; in Canada, including the right to explore for or exploit natural resources and rights to amounts computed by reference to production from natural resources. It is a question of fact as to whether the value of the shares of Common Stock results principally from real property in Canada. &nbsp;Although a tax opinion on this matter has not been obtained, given the nature of our business and stage of development, we have concluded that the value of our shares would likely fall into this category;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX">
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX">
<BR>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX">
<BR>
</P>
<HR STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:9.6PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:9.6PX" NOSHADE SIZE=1.333>
<A NAME="eolPage64"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS">
	64
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX">
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX">
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:-16PX; PADDING-LEFT:48PX; TEXT-INDENT:-48PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	(b)
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-LEFT:48PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	the non-resident holder is an individual who was resident in Canada for not less than 120 months during any period of 20 consecutive years preceding, and at any time during the 10 years immediately preceding, the disposition and the shares were owned by him when he ceased to be resident in Canada or are property substituted for property that was owned at that time; or
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX">
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:-16PX; PADDING-LEFT:48PX; TEXT-INDENT:-48PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	(c)
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PADDING-LEFT:48PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	the shares formed part of the business property of a &#147;permanent establishment&#148; or pertained to a fixed base used for the purpose of performing independent personal services that the stockholder has or had in Canada within the 12 months preceding the disposition.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	This Treaty relief is not available if the stockholder is an LLC.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	Notwithstanding the potential exemption from Canadian tax provided under the Treaty, where a non-resident of Canada disposes of Common Share that are taxable Canadian property, the non-resident is required to file a Canadian income tax return in respect of such dispositions.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>

<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC98298102">
</A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX">
<B>
	United States Federal Income Tax Consequences
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX">
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	The following is a discussion of all material United States Federal income tax consequences, under current law, that may be applicable to a U.S. Holder (as defined below) of shares of Common Stock. &nbsp;This discussion does not address all potentially relevant Federal income tax matters and it does not address consequences peculiar to persons subject to special provisions of Federal income tax law, such as those described below as excluded from the definition of a U.S. Holder. &nbsp;In addition, this discussion does not cover any state, local or foreign tax consequences. &nbsp;(See &#147;Canadian Federal Income Tax Consequences&#148; above.)
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	The following general discussion is based upon the sections of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, as amended to the date hereof (the &#147;Code&#148;), Treasury Regulations, published Internal Revenue Service (&#147;IRS&#148;) rulings, published administrative positions of the IRS and court decisions that are currently applicable, any or all of which could be materially and adversely changed, possibly on a retroactive basis, at any time. &nbsp;In addition, this discussion does not consider the potential effects, both adverse and beneficial, of any future legislation, which, if enacted, could be applied, possibly on a retroactive basis, at any time. &nbsp;Shareholders and prospective investors should consult their own tax advisors for advice regarding their individual tax consequences.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	Under current U.S. Treasury Regulations, reporting requirements may apply with respect to the payment of dividends to U.S. Holders of Common Stock. &nbsp;Specifically, non-corporate holders or holders not exempt from reporting requirements may be subject to backup withholding at a 28% rate (for 2005 and 2006) with respect to dividends when such holder (1) fails to furnish or certify a correct taxpayer identification number to the payor by furnishing a duly completed and signed Form W-9 in the required manner; and (2) is notified by the IRS that it has failed to report payments of interest or dividends properly; or (3) fails, under certain circumstances, to certify that it has been notified by the IRS that it is subject to backup withholding for failure to report interest and dividend payments.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC431180074">
</A>

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<I>
	U.S. Holders
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX">
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	As used herein, a &#147;U.S. Holder&#148; is a holder of shares of Common Stock who or which is a citizen or individual resident (or is treated as a citizen or individual resident) of the United States for federal income tax purposes, a corporation created or organized (or treated as created or organized for federal income tax purposes) in or under the laws of the United States or any political subdivision thereof, or a trust or estate the income of which is includable in its gross income for federal income tax purposes without regard to its source, if, (i)&nbsp;a court within the United States is able to exercise primary supervision over the administration of the trust and (ii)&nbsp;one or more United States trustees have the authority to control all substantial decisions of the trust. &nbsp;For purposes of this discussion, a U.S. Holder does not include persons subject to special provisions of Federal income tax law, including but not limited to persons who have a &#147;functional currency&#148; other than the U.S. dollar, persons who are partners or owners of partnerships or other pass-through entities, tax-exempt organizations, qualified retirement plans, financial institutions, insurance companies, real estate investment trusts, regulated investment companies, broker-dealers and Holders who acquired their stock through the exercise of employee stock options or otherwise as compensation.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>

<HR STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:9.6PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:9.6PX" NOSHADE SIZE=1.333>
<A NAME="eolPage65"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS">
	65
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX">
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX">
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<I>
	Distributions on shares of Common Stock
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	U.S. Holders receiving dividend distributions (including constructive dividends) with respect to shares of Common Stock are required to include in gross income for United States Federal income tax purposes the gross amount of such distributions to the extent that we have current or accumulated earnings and profits, without reduction for any Canadian income tax withheld from such distributions. &nbsp;Such Canadian tax withheld may be credited, subject to certain limitations, against the U.S. Holder's United States Federal income tax liability or, alternatively, may be deducted in computing the U.S. Holder's United States Federal taxable income by those who itemize deductions. &nbsp;(See more detailed discussion at &#147;Foreign Tax Credit&#148; below). &nbsp;To the extent that distributions exceed our current or accumulated earnings and profits, they will be treated first as a return of capital up to the U.S. Holder's adjusted basis in the shares of Common Stock and thereafter as gain from the sale or exchange of the shares of Common Stock. &nbsp;Preferential tax rates for long-term capital gains are applicable to a U.S. Holder, which is an individual, estate or trust. &nbsp;There are currently no preferential tax rates for long-term capital gains for a U.S. Holder which is a corporation. A U.S. Holder which is a corporation may, under certain circumstances, be entitled to a 70% deduction of the United States source portion of dividends received from a foreign corporation (other than a PFIC) if such U.S. Holder owns shares representing at least 10% of our voting power and value. &nbsp;The availability of this deduction is subject to several complex limitations, which are beyond the scope of this discussion. &nbsp;A U.S. Holder that is taxed under Section 1 of the Code may be entitled to certain preferential tax treatment on dividends received from a &#147;Qualified Foreign Corporation&#148; that is not a PFIC. Our directors believe that our company is a PFIC and therefore dividends from our company would not qualify for these benefits. &nbsp;See PFIC discussion below.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>

</A>

</A>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC66840992">
</A>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC66841149">
</A>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC66841308">
</A>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC95278061">
</A>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC95278212">
</A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<I>
	Foreign Tax Credit
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	A U.S. Holder who pays (or has withheld from distributions) Canadian income tax with respect to the ownership of shares of Common Stock may be entitled, at the option of the U.S. Holder, to either a deduction or a tax credit for such foreign tax paid or withheld. &nbsp;It will be more advantageous to claim a credit because a credit reduces United States Federal income taxes on a dollar-for-dollar basis, while a deduction merely reduces the taxpayer's income subject to tax. &nbsp;This election is made on a year-by-year basis and applies to all foreign taxes paid by (or withheld from) the U.S. Holder during that year. &nbsp;There are significant and complex limitations, which apply to the credit, among which is the general limitation that the credit cannot exceed the proportionate shares of the U.S. Holder's United States income tax liability that the U.S. Holder's foreign source income bears to his or its worldwide taxable income. &nbsp;In the determination of the application of this limitation, the various items of income and deduction must be classified into foreign and domestic sources. &nbsp;Complex rules govern this classification process. &nbsp;There are further limitations on the foreign tax credit for certain types of income such as &#147;passive income&#148;, &#147;high withholding tax interest&#148;, &#147;financial services income&#148;, &#147;shipping income&#148;, and certain other classifications of income. &nbsp;The availability of the foreign tax credit and the application of the limitations on the credit are fact specific and holders and prospective stockholders should consult their own tax advisors regarding their individual circumstances.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC431180077">
</A>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC451566022">
</A>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC451593725">
</A>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC451598268">
</A>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC465535860">
</A>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC465797213">
</A>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC470249978">
</A>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC470537557">
</A>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC470540537">
</A>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC472946378">
</A>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC481240917">
</A>

</A>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC34011975">
</A>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC34012452">
</A>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC34794522">
</A>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC65804554">
</A>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC66840993">
</A>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC66841150">

<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC66841309">

<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC95278213">
</A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<I>
	Disposition of shares of Common Stock
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	A U.S. Holder will recognize gain or loss upon the sale of shares of Common Stock equal to the difference, if any, between the amount of cash plus the fair market value of any property received, and the Holder's tax basis in the shares of Common Stock. &nbsp;This gain or loss will be capital gain or loss if the shares of Common Stock are a capital asset in the hands of the U.S. Holder unless our company was to become a controlled foreign corporation. &nbsp;For the effect on our company of becoming a controlled corporation, see &#147;Controlled Foreign Corporation Status&#148; below. &nbsp;Any capital gain will be a short-term or long-term capital gain or loss depending upon the holding period of the U.S. Holder. &nbsp;Gains and losses are netted and combined according to special rules in arriving at the overall capital gain or loss for a particular tax year. &nbsp;Deductions for net capital losses are subject to significant limitations. &nbsp;For U.S. Holders which are individuals, any unused portion of such net capital loss may be carried over to be used in later tax years until such net capital loss is thereby exhausted. &nbsp;For U.S. Holders, which are corporations (other than corporations subject to Subchapter S of the Code), an unused net capital loss may be carried back three years from the loss year and carried forward five years from the loss year to be offset against capital gains until such net capital loss is thereby exhausted.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC431180078">
</A>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC451566023">
</A>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC451593726">
</A>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC451598269">
</A>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC465535861">
</A>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC465797214">
</A>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC470249979">

<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC470537558">
</A>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC470540538">
</A>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC472946379">
</A>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC481240918">
</A>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC481245946">
</A>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC481419830">
</A>

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX">
<B>
	Other Considerations for U.S. Holders
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	In the following circumstances, the above sections of this discussion may not describe the United States Federal income tax consequences resulting from the holding and disposition of shares of Common Stock:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX">
<BR>
</P>
<HR STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:9.6PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:9.6PX" NOSHADE SIZE=1.333>
<A NAME="eolPage66"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS">
	66
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX">
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX">
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC431180081">
</A>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC451566026">
</A>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC451593729">
</A>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC451598272">
</A>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC465535864">
</A>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC465797217">
</A>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC470249982">
</A>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC470537561">
</A>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC470540541">
</A>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC472946382">
</A>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC481240921">
</A>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC481245949">
</A>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC481419833">
</A>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC517420591">
</A>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC9353142">
</A>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC9353370">
</A>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC9353588">
</A>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC34011201">
</A>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC34011979">
</A>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC34012456">
</A>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC34794526">
</A>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC65804558">
</A>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC66840997">
</A>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC66841154">
</A>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC66841313">
</A>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC95278066">
</A>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC95278217">
</A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<I>
	Passive Foreign Investment Company
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	A U.S. Holder who holds stock in a foreign corporation during any year in which such corporation qualifies as a passive foreign investment company (&#147;PFIC&#148;) is subject to U.S. federal income taxation under one of three alternative tax regimes as discussed below.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	Section 1297 of the Code defines a PFIC as a corporation that is not formed in the United States and, for any taxable year, either (i)&nbsp;75% or more of its gross income is &#147;passive income,&#148; which includes interest, dividends and certain rents and royalties or (ii)&nbsp;the average percentage, by fair market value (or, if the company is not publicly traded and either is a controlled foreign corporation or makes an election, adjusted tax basis), of its assets that produce or are held for the production of &#147;passive income&#148; is 50% or more. &nbsp;We believe that our company is a PFIC.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<I>
	QEF Election
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	As a PFIC, each U. S. Holder must determine under which of the alternative tax methods it wishes to be taxed. &nbsp;Under one method, a U.S. Holder who elects in a timely manner to treat our company as a Qualified Electing Fund (&#147;QEF&#148;), as defined in the Code, (an &#147;Electing U.S. Holder&#148;) will be subject, under Section 1293 of the Code, to current federal income tax for any taxable year in which we qualify as a PFIC on his pro-rata share of our (i) &#147;net capital gain&#148; (the excess of net long-term capital gain over net short-term capital loss), which will be taxed as long-term capital gain to the Electing U.S. Holder and (ii) &#147;ordinary earnings&#148; (the excess of earnings and profits over net capital gain), which will be taxed as ordinary income to the Electing U.S. Holder, in each case, for the U.S. Holder's taxable year in which (or with which) our taxable year ends, regardless of whether such amounts are actually distributed.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	A QEF election also allows the Electing U.S. Holder to (i) treat any gain realized on the disposition of his shares of Common Stock (or deemed to be realized on the pledge of his shares of Common Stock) as capital gain; (ii) treat his share of our net capital gain, if any, as long-term capital gain instead of ordinary income, and (iii) either avoid interest charges resulting from PFIC status altogether (see discussion of interest charge below), or make an annual election, subject to certain limitations, to defer payment of current taxes on his share of our annual realized net capital gain and ordinary earnings subject, however, to an interest charge. If the Electing U.S. Holder is not a corporation, such an interest charge would be treated as &#147;personal interest&#148; that is not deductible.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	The procedure a U.S. Holder must comply with in making a timely QEF election will depend on whether the year of the election is the first year in the U.S. Holder's holding period in which we are a PFIC. &nbsp;If the U.S. Holder makes a QEF election in such first year, (sometimes referred to as a &#147;Pedigreed QEF Election&#148;), then the U.S. Holder may make the QEF election by simply filing the appropriate documents at the time the U.S. Holder files its tax return for such first year. &nbsp;If, however, our company qualified as a PFIC in a prior year, then in addition to filing documents, the U.S. Holder must also elect to recognize as an &#147;excess distribution&#148; (i) under the rules of Section 1291 (discussed below), any gain that he would otherwise recognize if the U.S. Holder sold his stock on the application date or (ii) if our company is a controlled foreign corporation (&#147;CFC&#148;), the Holder's pro rata share of the corporation's earnings and profits. (But see &#147;Elimination of Overlap Between Subpart&nbsp;F Rules and PFIC Provisions&#148;). Either the deemed sale election or the deemed dividend election will result in the U.S. Holder being deemed to have made a timely QEF election.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	With respect to a situation in which a Pedigreed QEF election is made, if our company no longer qualifies as a PFIC in a subsequent year, normal Code rules and not the PFIC rules will apply.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<I>
	Section 1291 Rules
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	If a U.S. Holder has not made a QEF Election at any time (a &#147;Non-electing U.S. Holder&#148;), then special taxation rules under Section 1291 of the Code will apply to (i) gains realized on the disposition (or deemed to be realized by reason of a pledge) of his shares of Common Stock and (ii) certain &#147;excess distributions&#148;.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	A Non-electing U.S. Holder would be required to pro-rate all gains realized on the disposition of his shares of Common Stock and all excess distributions over the entire holding period for the shares of Common Stock. &nbsp;All gains or excess distributions allocated to prior years of the U.S. Holder (other than years prior to the first taxable year of our company during
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX">
<BR>
</P>
<HR STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:9.6PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:9.6PX" NOSHADE SIZE=1.333>
<A NAME="eolPage67"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS">
	67
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX">
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX">
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	such U.S. Holder's holding period and beginning after January 1, 1987 for which it was a PFIC) would be taxed at the highest tax rate for each such prior year applicable to ordinary income. The Non-electing U.S. Holder also would be liable for interest on the foregoing tax liability for each such prior year calculated as if such liability had been due with respect to each such prior year. &nbsp;A Non-electing U.S. holder that is not a corporation must treat this interest charge as &#147;personal interest&#148; which, as discussed above, is wholly non-deductible. &nbsp;The balance of the gain or the excess distribution will be treated as ordinary income in the year of the disposition or distribution, and no interest charge will be incurred with respect to such balance.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	If our company is a PFIC for any taxable year during which a Non-electing U.S. Holder holds shares of Common Stock, then we will continue to be treated as a PFIC with respect to such shares of Common Stock, even if it is no longer by definition a PFIC. &nbsp;A Non-electing U.S. Holder may terminate this deemed PFIC status by electing to recognize gain (which will be taxed under the rules discussed above for Non-Electing U.S. Holders) as if such shares of Common Stock had been sold on the last day of the last taxable year for which it was a PFIC.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	Under proposed regulations, dispositions of PFIC stock would include gifts, exchanges pursuant to corporate reorganizations, and transfers at death.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	If a U.S. Holder makes a QEF Election that is not a Pedigreed Election (i.e., it is made after the first year during which our company is a PFIC and the U.S. Holder holds shares of Common Stock) (a &#147;Non-Pedigreed Election&#148;), the QEF rules apply prospectively but do not apply to years prior to the year in which the QEF first becomes effective. U.S. Holders should consult their tax advisors regarding the specific consequences of making a Non-Pedigreed QEF Election.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	The foregoing discussion is based on currently effective provisions of the Code, existing and proposed regulations thereunder, and current administrative rulings and court decisions, all of which are subject to change. &nbsp;Any such change could affect the validity of this discussion. In addition, the implementation of certain aspects of the PFIC rules requires the issuance of regulations which in many instances have not been promulgated and which may have retroactive effect. &nbsp;There can be no assurance that any of these proposals will be enacted or promulgated, and if so, the form they will take or the effect that they may have on this discussion. Accordingly, and due to the complexity of the PFIC rules, U.S. Holders of Common Stock should consult their own tax advisors concerning PFIC rules and the impact of these rules on their investment in our company. &nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<I>
	Mark-to-Market Election for PFIC Stock
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	Under Section 1296 of the Code, a U.S. Holder of a PFIC may make a mark-to-market election with respect to the stock of the PFIC if such stock is marketable as defined below. &nbsp;This provision is designed to provide a current inclusion provision for persons that are Non-Electing Holders. &nbsp;Under the election, any excess of the fair market value of the PFIC stock at the close of the tax year over the Holder's adjusted basis in the stock is included in the Holder's income. &nbsp;The Holder may deduct any excess of the adjusted basis of the PFIC stock over its fair market value at the close of the tax year. &nbsp;However, deductions are limited to the net mark-to-market gains on the stock that the Holder included in income in prior tax years, or so called &#147;unreversed inclusions.&#148;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	For purposes of the election, PFIC stock is marketable if it is regularly traded on (1)&nbsp;a national securities exchange that is registered with the SEC, (2)&nbsp;the national market system established under Section&nbsp;11A of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, or (3)&nbsp;an exchange or market that the IRS determines has rules sufficient to ensure that the market price represents legitimate and sound fair market value.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	A Holder's adjusted basis of PFIC stock is increased by the income recognized under the mark-to-market election and decreased by the deductions allowed under the election. &nbsp;If a U.S. Holder owns PFIC stock indirectly through a foreign entity, the basis adjustments apply to the basis of the PFIC stock in the hands of the foreign entity for the purpose of applying the PFIC rules to the tax treatment of the U.S. owner. &nbsp;Similar basis adjustments are made to the basis of the property through which the U.S. persons hold the PFIC stock.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	Income recognized under the mark-to-market election and gain on the sale of PFIC stock with respect to which an election is made is treated as ordinary income. &nbsp;Deductions allowed under the election and loss on the sale of PFIC with respect to which an election is made, to the extent that the amount of loss does not exceed the net mark-to-market gains previously included,
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX">
<BR>
</P>
<HR STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:9.6PX; MARGIN-BOTTOM:9.6PX" NOSHADE SIZE=1.333>
<A NAME="eolPage68"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX; PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS">
	68
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX">
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX">
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	are treated as ordinary losses. &nbsp;The U.S. or foreign source of any income or losses is determined as if the amount were a gain or loss from the sale of stock in the PFIC.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	The above provisions apply to tax years of U.S. persons beginning after December&nbsp;31, 1997, and to tax years of foreign corporations ending with or within such tax years of U.S. persons.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	The rules of Code Section 1291 applicable to nonqualified funds do not apply to a U.S. Holder for tax years for which a mark-to-market election is in effect. &nbsp;If Code Section 1291 is applied and a mark-to-market election was in effect for any prior tax year, the U.S. Holder's holding period for the PFIC stock is treated as beginning immediately after the last tax year of the election. &nbsp;However, if a taxpayer makes a mark-to-market election for PFIC stock that is a nonqualified fund after the beginning of a taxpayer's holding period for such stock, a coordination rule applies to ensure that the taxpayer does not avoid the interest charge with respect to amounts attributable to periods before the election.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<BR>
</P>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC431180082">
</A>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC451566027">
</A>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC451593730">
</A>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC451598273">
</A>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC465535865">
</A>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC465797218">
</A>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC470249983">
</A>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC470537562">
</A>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC470540542">
</A>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC472946383">
</A>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC481240922">
</A>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC481245950">
</A>

</A>

</A>

</A>
<A NAME="PLATINUM20FA052107_HTM__TOC66840998">
</A>

</A>
